DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Laparoscopic Port Size 2 Digit MM Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the size or physical magnitude, measured as in two digit millimeter, of the medical appliance inserted into an incision for laparoscopic examination that allows other laparoscopy devices to pass through the skin and into the abdominal cavity.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the size or physical magnitude of the medical appliance inserted into an incision for laparoscopic examination that allows other laparoscopy devices to pass through the skin and into the abdominal cavity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: A medical appliance inserted into an incision for laparoscopic examination that provides a pathway for allows other laparoscopy devices to pass through the skin and into the abdominal cavity.:Size; the physical magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: A medical appliance inserted into an incision for laparoscopic examination that provides a pathway for allows other laparoscopy devices to pass through the skin and into the abdominal cavity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::2_A single character in a numbering system._A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch._Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::2:A single character in a numbering system.:A unit of measure equaling one thousandth of a meter. (NCI):Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A single character in a numbering system.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/6/10 - released as part of content cleanup; VD not finalized with ACRIN but reused by multiple other CDEs.  8/14/08   - Created to support curation of ACRIN GYN MRI data elements.
